newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS - prices up 3/8 to 1/2.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS - prices up 3/8 to 1/2.

text.p: U.S. municipal bonds ended the day up 3/8 to 1/2 point enjoying the strength in the U.S. Treasury market.
Bond-friendly news on March consumer prices pushed U.S. Treasuries nearly a point higher at the end of the day. The benchmark 30-year bond was up 29/32 to yield 7.09 percent.
In the municipal market, high grade bonds were up an 03 to up an 05, depending on name and maturity, one municipal analyst said. Revenue bonds closed up 1/2.
Activity was moderate, although there were a few lists out for the bid. Rather than a lot of cash activity, some market players are focusing on bond swaps.
"It was a good day," said one market participant.
And new issue pricing was firm.
"The secondary market has taken a backseat to the new issue market," said another participant.
Municipal bond sales for Wednesday, April 16 are expected to total $850 million in 27 sales, according to Reuters Municipal Bond Information Group.
Negotiated offerings total $793 million in nine sales, with a $197 million Metropolitan Transit Authority deal through Bear, Stearns & Co. Inc. topping the list.
On the competitive side, 18 sales totaling $57 million are on the schedule. A $22 million Oakland, Calif., at 1300 EDT is the largest.
An additional 14 sales totaling $301 million are on the possible calender, meaning underwriters have said they may price the bonds Wednesday, depending on market conditions.
In debt futures, the June municipal futures contract closed 112-19/32. The June T-bond contract closed at 20/32. The MOB spread closed 159 ticks, down from Monday's close of 163.
